Add authorization/permission negative tests to cover 403 Forbidden when an authenticated user does not have rights to update the target account.
Assert response headers and metadata in success and error scenarios (Content-Type, potential Location header, and any KillBill-specific headers) to ensure clients can rely on response contract.
Standardize and test error response schema across scenarios: verify presence of fields like errorCode, message, and fieldErrors where applicable to ensure consistent client parsing.
Add rate-limiting tests to validate 429 responses or throttling behavior under bursts, even if unlikely for this endpoint; this complements performance tests.
Add tests for conflict semantics (409) if business rules define conflicts beyond validation errors; clarify expected behavior for duplicate resource identifiers.
Add tests to assert audit propagation and logging impact (e.g., that X-Killbill-CreatedBy is persisted in audit logs or returned in response where applicable).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered_items: Valid Payload (POST): Multiple happy-path scenarios (single, multiple tags, existing/no-existing tags) with 201 responses are present (TC01-TC05, TC13, TC20, TC22).
Optional/Required Headers: Tests cover required header presence, optional headers X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment, and missing required header (TC03, TC06).
Invalid Payload / Validation: Malformed JSON, empty array, invalid tag definition IDs, null/empty entries, extra unsupported parameters are tested (TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC24).
Resource Not Found / Invalid ID: Non-existent invoice item and invalid invoice item id format are tested (TC07, TC08, TC15).
Duplicate Handling: Duplicate tag definition UUIDs and adding existing tags regression are tested to ensure no duplication (TC13, TC20).
Large Payloads & Limits: Very large payload scenario is present (TC19) for payload-too-large or success handling.
Performance / Load: A heavy-load performance test with response-time expectation is included (TC14).
Authentication / Authorization: Unauthorized access scenario is present (TC16).
Dependency / Integration Failures: Dependent tag-definition service unavailability is covered (TC21).
Service Availability / Timeouts: Service unavailable and timeout conditions are covered (TC17, TC25).
Security Input Validation: Malicious payloads (SQL/script injection) are tested (TC18).
gaps: GET-specific guidelines: Pagination, caching, query-parameter variations and ETag/Cache-Control checks are not applicable to this POST endpoint but appear in the standard checklist and are not covered (no tests necessary for POST, however documentation should note this).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests simulate many rapid requests to verify rate limiting or protection against abusive request bursts.
Server Error (500) / DB Failure: No explicit test that simulates internal server/database errors resulting in 5xx responses (other than dependency 503).
Concurrency / Race Conditions: No tests for concurrent submissions (e.g., two clients adding the same tag simultaneously) to detect race conditions or locking issues.
Content-Type / Response Headers: No assertions around response Content-Type, caching headers, Location header (if applicable), or other important response headers.

Boundary Conditions (numeric limits & tag definition size): While large payload is covered, there is no test for exact allowed maximums (e.g., allowed number of tags) besides an assumed max-tags scenario (TC23) — missing tests for exact boundary values.

Validation of tagDefinition UUID format vs existence: Tests check invalid UUID format and invalid tag id but could separate format validation (malformed UUID) vs non-existent but valid-format UUID (partial overlap exists but not explicit).

Idempotency and Duplicate Submission semantics: Duplicate-submission behavior covered for duplicates within single request, but not for repeated identical requests (client retries) to validate idempotency semantics.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: simulate many concurrent POSTs to verify 429 or throttling behavior and ensure graceful handling.
Add server-error simulations: introduce tests that simulate database failures or 500 Internal Server Error to validate API error handling and meaningful error messages.
Add concurrency tests: simulate concurrent requests adding the same tag(s) to detect race conditions and ensure correct deduplication/locking.

Add precise boundary tests: include tests for the exact maximum allowed number of tags (N) and N+1 to ensure correct 400 behavior; test medium-large payloads to locate soft limits before 10,000 item case.
Add Content-Type and response header assertions: validate Content-Type, Location (if applicable), and that responses include or intentionally omit caching headers for POST.
Split validation scenarios: add separate tests for malformed UUID format vs well-formed but non-existent UUIDs to ensure distinct error messages and codes.
Add idempotency/retry behavior tests: repeat the same request (retries) to validate that clients can safely retry without creating duplicates or undesired side effects.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/pagination - List bundles

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios (default params, explicit offset/limit, combinations) verify the happy paths and default behaviors.
Empty Response: TC06 and TC07 verify behavior when no data or offset beyond dataset returns an empty array.
Pagination: Numerous tests exercise offset/limit behavior including default limit, large dataset slicing (TC02, TC05, TC21), and boundary/invalid values (TC11, TC16).

Query Parameters: Positive and negative parameter cases are covered (audit values FULL/MINIMAL/NONE, invalid audit, negative offset/limit, extra unexpected params — TC03, TC04, TC10, TC08, TC09, TC15).
Authorization: TC12 tests missing/invalid authentication handling (401 expected).
Error handling / dependency failure: TC13, TC22 handle service unavailability and timeouts; invalid-parameter error cases are present (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC14, TC16).
Security: TC14 explicitly covers SQL injection attempts in query parameters.
Performance: TC17 and TC18 provide response-time/performance checks under normal and peak load.
Regression/Backward compatibility: TC19 and TC20 cover known regressions and default audit behavior.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests assert caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests verify behaviour under rapid repeated requests (rate-limit headers, 429 responses).
Schema & Content-Type Validation: Tests do not assert response Content-Type, exact Bundle JSON schema or field-level validation (required fields, types, formats).

Exact limit-default and max-limit enforcement: While limit error cases exist, there is no test that asserts the documented default (limit=100) is returned when omitted beyond verifying size <=100, nor a test that asserts the precise maximum allowed limit value and its boundary behavior (what exact max is allowed vs rejected).
Authorization nuances: No tests for forbidden (403) vs unauthorized (401) differences, nor role-based access variations if applicable.
Caching + Pagination interplay: No test for correct cache behavior when paginated resources change between requests (ETag/If-None-Match with pagination).
Rate-limit + Performance edge: No tests combining high concurrency with rate-limiting expectations (e.g., some requests should receive 429).
Error response content standardization: Tests assert presence of an error message but not consistent error codes/structures (error code format, machine-readable fields).
recommendations: Add tests that assert caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) are present and correct, and include conditional GET flows (If-None-Match → 304) for paginated responses.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: repeated rapid requests to verify 429 responses or throttling behavior and any rate-limit response headers (Retry-After, X-RateLimit-*).
Add strict schema validation tests for Bundle objects: verify Content-Type is application/json and that each Bundle includes required fields with correct types/format (UUIDs, dates, nested objects).

Add boundary tests for the exact documented defaults and maximums: verify default limit=100 when omitted, and validate the exact maximum allowed limit value (and the precise status code and error body when exceeded).
Expand authorization tests: include 403/role-based access scenarios if the API supports scopes/roles, and validate authentication header formats (expired token, malformed token).
Add tests for caching+paginaton edge cases: when underlying data changes between paginated requests, ensure consistency or expected behavior is documented and tested.
Standardize error response assertions: assert structure (code, message, details) for error responses across invalid-parameter, auth, and dependency failures.
Include rate-limit + performance combination tests to document expected behavior under high concurrency (some requests succeed, some 429) and to validate graceful degradation.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache - Invalidates the given Cache if specified, otherwise invalidates all caches

covered_items: Valid Deletion: Success scenarios for invalidating all caches and a specific cache (TC01, TC02) map to the acceptance criteria and expected 204 responses.
Non-Existent Resource: Error scenario when cache does not exist is covered (TC03) with expected 400 response.
Invalid Resource State: Error scenario for cache that exists but is not alive is covered (TC04) with expected 400 response.
Input Validation: Several negative tests cover invalid cacheName formats, empty values, very large values, special characters and previously problematic formats (TC05, TC10, TC11, TC15).
Authorization: Unauthorized access is tested (TC06) to ensure 401/403 behavior.
Server Error Handling: System/internal error scenario is present (TC07) to validate 500 handling.
Concurrency and Performance: High-load/performance and concurrent request scenarios are included (TC13, TC14) to cover performance and basic concurrency concerns.
Empty-state Handling: Behavior when no caches exist is covered (TC08).
Unsupported Query Parameters: Behavior with extra/unsupported query params is covered (TC09).
Case-sensitivity: Mixed-case cacheName behaviour is explicitly tested (TC12).
gaps: Pagination: Although listed in guidelines, pagination is not applicable to this DELETE endpoint; no tests (and likely none needed) — clarification recommended.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: There is a concurrency test, but no explicit rate-limiting or throttling tests (e.g., > allowed requests per second and expected 429 responses).

Detailed Authorization Variants: TC06 covers unauthenticated/invalid token broadly, but lacks separate tests for insufficient permissions (401 vs 403 distinction), token expiry, and role-based access control permutations.

Atomicity / Partial-Failure Behavior: No tests verify atomicity when invalidating multiple caches (e.g., partial failures when some caches fail to invalidate) and whether operation is all-or-nothing or best-effort.
Idempotency: No explicit tests for idempotency (repeated identical DELETE calls should produce same outcome/status).
Audit / Side Effects: No tests validate any side effects such as logging, audit entries, or metrics (which may be required for admin operations).
Response Headers and Content-Type: Tests assert empty body and status codes but do not assert response headers (e.g., Content-Type, caching headers, or diagnostic headers).
Input Encoding and Injection Hardening: While special characters are tested, there are no tests for URL encoding edge cases, very long encoded input, or attempts at injection beyond the one example.
recommendations: Confirm pagination is not applicable; if it is not, document that the DELETE endpoint does not support pagination so it can be excluded from testing scope.
Add explicit rate-limiting tests that flood the endpoint to verify 429 or throttling behavior if the platform enforces rate limits.
Expand authorization tests to cover: valid admin vs non-admin roles (403), expired/invalid tokens (401), and permission boundary cases.
Add idempotency tests: repeat the same DELETE (both specific cache and all caches) multiple times to verify stable responses and no unintended side effects.

Add partial-failure/atomicity tests: simulate a mix of alive and failing caches to verify whether the API performs an all-or-nothing invalidate or partial invalidation and returns appropriate status/details.
Add assertions on response headers (Content-Type, potential diagnostic headers) and ensure empty bodies still have appropriate headers.
Add tests for URL-encoding edge cases and additional injection vectors (e.g., percent-encoded long strings) to harden input handling beyond single special-character cases.
If audit/logging is required for admin actions, add tests that verify audit entries or metrics are produced as part of the operation.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allTags - Retrieve account tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios (TC01-TC07, TC20-TC21) validate successful retrieval with various parameter combinations.
Query Parameters: Extensive tests for objectType, includedDeleted, and audit values including valid combinations (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC16, TC20, TC21) and invalid values (TC22).
Empty Response: TC07 covers an account with no tags returning an empty array.
Error Handling: Invalid accountId (TC09), non-existent account (TC08, TC25), downstream service unavailable (TC11), timeout (TC15), and malformed inputs/SQL injection (TC12) are covered.
Authorization: Unauthorized access is tested (TC10) verifying 401 responses.
Integration: End-to-end consistency after add/delete via other APIs is covered (TC18, TC19).
Concurrency/Load: Concurrency is tested (TC23) and large dataset performance/response size is considered (TC14).
Content-Type: Response header content-type check is included (TC27).
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Regression and backward compatibility are addressed (TC16, TC17).
Partial/State Variations: Account soft-deleted and empty database states are considered (TC25, TC26).
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination behavior or limits for very large result sets (no paging params, offsets, or limits tested).
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or conditional GETs (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or behavior on repeated requests.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting or behavior when request quotas are exceeded.
Authorization Variants: No tests for 403 Forbidden (insufficient privileges / role-based access), only 401 is covered.
HTTP 500 / Internal Server Error: General server-side 500 error and recovery are not explicitly covered (only 503 and 504).
Pagination-related performance edge cases: TC14 addresses large number of tags but doesn’t verify paginated endpoints or streaming behavior; no tests for partial responses or truncation.
Caching + Concurrency interaction: No tests that combine caching behavior with concurrent updates to ensure consistency (stale reads).
Request/Response header validations: Apart from Content-Type, other important headers (Content-Length, ETag, Cache-Control, Retry-After on 503/429) are not validated.
Rate-limit related headers and behavior: No tests assert presence of Retry-After or 429 responses under throttling.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: include scenarios for page size/offset or cursor-based paging (if applicable), boundary values, and correct ordering of tags across pages.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag/If-None-Match and Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since behavior and presence of Cache-Control headers.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate high request rates to validate 429 responses, Retry-After header, and graceful degradation.
Include authorization role/permission tests: verify 403 responses for authenticated but unauthorized requests and cover different principal roles.
Add 500/internal error handling tests: simulate generic server errors and verify appropriate 500 responses and safe error messages without leaking internals.
Enhance performance and large dataset tests to exercise both raw large responses and paginated retrieval to validate latency, memory use, and correctness under load.
Add tests validating other important response headers (Content-Length, ETag, Cache-Control, Retry-After) and consistency across repeated requests.
Combine concurrency with caching and mutation scenarios to detect stale reads or race conditions (e.g., concurrent add/delete while cached responses exist).

Document and test expected default parameter behavior explicitly (mapping between omitted parameters and server defaults) and include tests for unsupported parameter names producing warnings or ignored behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/renameKey - Update a bundle externalKey

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01 covers the happy path (204) and verifies the externalKey is updated.
Non-Existing Resource: TC04 and TC15 cover bundle-not-found cases (404) when bundles are missing.
Invalid Identifier Format: TC03 checks malformed bundleId format (400).
Required Headers: TC01, TC02 and Background address X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence and missing header error handling.
Request Body Validation: TC06, TC07, TC08 cover missing body, malformed JSON, and missing externalKey.
Conflict Handling: TC05 addresses externalKey already in use for the same account (400).
Optional Headers: TC14 verifies X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment handling.
Edge Cases for externalKey: TC09 (extra fields), TC10 (very long key), TC11 (empty key), TC19 (special characters), TC20 (leading/trailing spaces).
Authorization: TC12 covers missing/invalid auth token (401/403).
Service availability: TC13 covers dependent service/database unavailable (503).
Concurrency: TC17 tests concurrent updates and expected conflict behavior.
Performance/Load basics: TC16 and TC23 include large payload and response-time expectations.
Regression/Backward compatibility: TC18 and TC22 cover regression/legacy-client scenarios.
Unexpected headers: TC21 covers robustness to extra headers.
Documentation accessibility: TC24 verifies API docs availability and accessibility.
gaps: Content-Type and Response Content-Type verification: While Background sets request Content-Type, there are no explicit tests asserting request rejection when Content-Type is missing/incorrect nor assertions on response Content-Type (story indicates produces application/json).

Exact success-body contract: The story mentions producing application/json but success is 204 (typically no body) — tests do not assert that the response body is empty or contains JSON; ambiguity is untested.

UUID pattern enforcement boundary: TC03 checks malformed id, but there is no explicit positive test that valid UUIDs matching the documented regex are accepted beyond using a sample valid id; no automated validation of pattern edge-cases (e.g., length, allowed characters).

Cross-account conflicts allowed/denied: The story specifies conflict within the same account; there is no test verifying that the same externalKey is allowed for bundles belonging to different accounts (expected behavior not explicitly tested).
Duplicate submission idempotency: No tests for repeated identical requests (replay/duplicate submission) and how duplicates are handled.

Partial update semantics: The guideline asks to verify partial updates are rejected unless allowed — there is no explicit test proving that only the externalKey field is permitted and other fields are ignored or rejected (TC09 checks extra fields but assumes success; it does not assert whether extra fields are stored or ignored).
Input validation beyond presence: No tests for invalid data types for externalKey (e.g., numeric, boolean), unicode normalization, or prohibited character sets beyond a single special-character test.

Header validation beyond presence: No tests for invalid values in X-Killbill-CreatedBy (e.g., overly long or binary), or ensuring X-Killbill-Reason is optional but when present is handled correctly (beyond existence).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate limiting or handling of many requests in a short time.
Caching behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) — not typical for PUT but present in guidelines to consider.
Error body schema/content: Tests assert presence of an error message but do not validate standardized error schema/fields (error codes, machine-readable fields).
Security headers and audit trail: No tests to verify that the createdBy/reason/comment are persisted in audit logs or returned in relevant metadata.
recommendations: Add tests to assert Content-Type handling: include a test sending the request without Content-Type or with an incorrect Content-Type and expect 400 (or appropriate) and a test asserting response Content-Type when an error body is returned and that success (204) has an empty body.
Clarify and test success contract: decide whether 204 must have no body or produce application/json; add tests to assert the chosen behavior.
Add cross-account conflict test: create bundles in two different accounts with same externalKey and verify update is allowed for different accounts (or assert intended behavior).
Add duplicate-submission/idempotency tests: send the same request twice and verify idempotency or appropriate error handling.
Add stricter partial-update tests: send body with other bundle fields (e.g., accountId, createdDate) and assert they are ignored/rejected and only externalKey is considered.
Add input-type and normalization tests: try numeric/boolean externalKey values, unicode normalization (combining characters), and multiple character-set cases to validate validation rules.
Add header validation tests: invalid/too-long X-Killbill-CreatedBy and behavior when X-Killbill-Reason or Comment exceed expected lengths.
Add automated assertions for error response schema: check error object fields, machine-readable error codes, and consistent messages for 400/404/503 cases.
Add rate-limiting and throttling tests (stress test) and verify server responses under burst traffic.
Add audit/logging checks in integration tests to verify X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded (if required by product).
Add tests to verify behavior under repeated concurrent updates with precise expected status codes (e.g., 409 vs 400) and validate which update ultimately persisted.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Retrieve bundle tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (no params, includedDeleted, audit variants, combined params) verify successful retrieval and response 200.
Empty Response: Scenario for a bundle with no tags verifies empty-array behavior and 200 response.
Query Parameters: Tests cover valid and invalid query parameter combinations (includedDeleted true/false, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, invalid audit value) and unexpected params.
Error Handling for Path Param: Invalid UUID format -> 400 and non-existent bundle -> 404 are covered.
Authorization: Missing and invalid authentication token scenarios cover basic authorization failures (401).
Performance/Load: Concurrency and large-result scenarios exist to exercise performance behavior and regression for deleted-tags handling.
Input Validation / Security: Injection/malicious payload test checks for input validation and appropriate error codes.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios exercise pagination (page size, offsets, limits, boundary conditions) for large result sets.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for API rate limiting behavior (429 responses, backoff, request burst handling).
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers or conditional-get behavior (ETag, Last-Modified, If-None-Match -> 304).
Authorization Coverage Depth: Tests cover missing/invalid token (401) but do not verify authorization scopes/roles or 403 responses for authenticated-but-forbidden access.

HTTP Error/Resilience Cases: No explicit tests for 500-class server errors or graceful degradation/retry behavior when downstream dependencies fail (besides a slow dependency simulation which is partial).
Pagination+Performance Interaction: Large dataset test checks response time but does not combine with pagination to validate correct chunking and performance per page.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify limit/offset or page parameters, default page size, boundaries (last page empty), and consistency of results across pages for large tag sets.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate request bursts to verify 429 responses or documented throttling behavior and ensure clients receive Retry-After where applicable.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag/Last-Modified headers and behavior of If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since returning 304.
Expand authorization tests: include authenticated-but-forbidden scenarios (403) and tests for different credential scopes/roles if the API enforces RBAC.
Add server-error and retry behavior tests: simulate 5xx responses from the service or downstream storage and verify client-visible behavior, error messages, and logging.
Enhance performance tests to combine pagination with large datasets and verify response time and resource utilization per page; also profile memory/CPU for large responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/plan - Retrieve plan for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01–TC04, TC13, TC19, TC20 cover successful retrieval across combinations of subscriptionId and requestedDate, including boundary and regression cases.
Empty Response: TC03, TC04 and TC11 address cases where no matching plan exists or the DB is empty.
Query Parameters: Many combinations are tested (both params, only one param, neither, malformed values) via TC01–TC08, TC13, TC14.
Authorization: TC09 verifies missing/invalid authentication handling (401).
Error Handling: TC05–TC08 and TC10 cover malformed inputs, non-existent resources, combined invalid parameters, and service unavailability (400/404/503/409/500 scenarios).
Security: TC17 and TC18 test injection/XSS attempts for input validation.
Performance: TC15 and TC16 include response-time and concurrent-request scenarios.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior (limit/offset/page params, large result sets, or paging headers).
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GETs (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since), or correct 304 responses.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: There are performance tests but no explicit tests for rate limits (429 responses) or client throttling behavior.
Content Negotiation / Headers: Tests do not verify Content-Type, Accept header handling, or response encoding.
Authorization nuance: There is a 401 test but no tests for forbidden access (403) or role/permission based access control if applicable.

Explicit validation of response schema details: While tests state "valid JSON Plan object", there are no explicit scenarios validating required Plan fields, types, or unexpected/missing fields and error formats (e.g., consistent 400 vs 422).

Consistency of error codes: Edge scenarios like overlapping plans (TC12) map to 409/500 but no assertion of a single expected standard; the suite lacks tests that assert the exact standardized error contract/structure.
Rate-limit vs performance distinction: Performance tests exist but they do not simulate abusive request patterns to confirm server responds with rate-limit headers and 429 responses.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create datasets with many subscriptions/plans and test limit/offset/page query parameters, paged responses, next/prev links or headers, and behavior when paging beyond available data.

Add caching tests: verify presence and semantics of ETag and Cache-Control headers, test conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) to assert 304 responses and proper cache invalidation when plans change.
Add explicit rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts/abusive request patterns to confirm 429 responses and Retry-After header behavior.
Expand header and content-negotiation tests: assert Content-Type application/json, accept header handling, character encoding, and response size limits.
Improve authorization coverage: test 403 forbidden scenarios if role-based restrictions exist and test token expiry/refresh flows.
Add strict schema validation tests: validate the Plan object fields, types, required fields, and error payload shape to ensure contract stability (include negative tests for missing/extra fields).

Clarify and enforce consistent error codes: add tests that assert the exact expected status code and error body for overlapping plans, missing data, and invalid inputs (choose 400 vs 422 consistently).
Add explicit rate-limit vs performance separation: keep current performance tests but add separate tests that intentionally exceed quota to confirm throttling behavior distinct from slow responses.
Add tests for unexpected query parameters and header combinations that assert harmless ignoring of unknown params and no sensitive leakage in responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01 and TC02 cover the successful PUT semantics (204) including the host state change and idempotent re-apply when already in rotation.
Authorization & Authentication: TC03, TC04 and TC09 cover unauthenticated (401) and insufficient-permission (403) cases and missing auth headers.
Method semantics: TC06 covers incorrect HTTP method (405).
Service availability & server-side failure: TC05 covers service/unreachable (503).
Request robustness: TC07 and TC08 cover unexpected payloads and extra headers being tolerated and still returning 204.
Resilience & retries: TC13 covers transient network interruptions with retry behavior.
Performance/degraded behavior: TC10 covers operation under high load and acceptable timeout behavior.
Concurrency/race conditions: TC14 addresses multiple concurrent PUTs and race-condition concerns.
Security: TC12 attempts header injection to validate the system is not vulnerable to simple injection vectors.
Regression: TC11 ensures previously fixed rotation bugs remain fixed.
gaps: Response content-type and headers: There is no explicit test verifying response headers (e.g., Content-Type application/json as stated in the story) or other relevant headers that should be returned with 204 responses.

Non-existing resource / host identity: No scenario covers the case where the target host does not exist or cannot be identified (the story assumes 'a host', but tests do not exercise an explicit non-existent-host error path).
500 / Internal Server Error: Tests do not explicitly simulate internal server errors (e.g., DB failure) and verify a 500 response or appropriate error handling beyond 503.
Idempotency semantics beyond simple re-apply: While TC02 covers already-in-rotation, there is no deeper verification of side effects or logs/audits to ensure no duplicate state changes occur.

Detailed input validation: Although PUT has no body per story, tests do not assert robustness against malformed headers beyond TC12; there is no explicit test for malformed cookies, malformed auth tokens format, or invalid header encodings.

Partial update / payload rejection: PUT guideline mentions partial updates; tests don't assert that partial/structured payloads are rejected or validated (TC07 allows non-empty body but doesn't cover validation of structured payloads).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate limiting or excessive requests beyond TC14 concurrency; no negative tests for throttling responses (e.g., 429).
Caching and related headers: No tests for caching behavior or presence/absence of ETag/Cache-Control headers.

Timeout & retry policy details: TC10 and TC13 check for timeout and retry success, but there are no explicit tests for configurable timeout thresholds, exponential backoff, or partial failure behaviors.
Audit/logging/observability: No tests assert that the operation is logged/audited or that metrics are emitted.
recommendations: Add tests to assert response headers including Content-Type (application/json) even for 204 responses and any required auditing headers.
Add a scenario where the specified host cannot be found or identified and assert the correct error is returned (e.g., 404 or appropriate business error).
Introduce tests that simulate internal server errors (database, dependency failure) to validate 500 responses and error bodies.
Add tests for rate limiting and throttling (e.g., many requests in a short period producing 429) and verify graceful handling.
Add negative tests for malformed authentication tokens, malformed headers, and invalid header encodings to ensure robust input validation.
If PUT with payloads is unsupported, add explicit tests asserting that structured/partial payloads are either ignored or rejected with a clear response (to satisfy 'Partial Update' guideline).
Extend concurrency tests to check for side effects, duplicate state transitions, and idempotency by validating system state changes, logs, or timestamps to ensure no race corruption.
Add tests to validate timeout configuration and retry/backoff behavior explicitly (e.g., assert response when backend calls time out vs. eventual success after retry).
Add observability/audit tests that verify an audit record or log entry is created when a host is put back into rotation, if that is a requirement.
Add a test that verifies behavior and response when dependencies are slow but still within SLA vs. when they exceed SLA (to complement TC10).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios cover successful retrievals (minimal params, includedDeleted, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, combined options).
Empty Response: TC05 covers the case where an invoice item has no tags and expects an empty JSON array.
Query Parameters: Positive and negative tests for accountId, includedDeleted, and audit are present (valid, missing, invalid values, extra unexpected params).
Error Handling: 400 (invalid formats/missing params), 404 (not found), 401 (missing/invalid auth), and 503 (backend unavailable) error scenarios are specified.
Schema Validation: TC01 asserts that Tag objects conform to the Tag schema.
Security: Injection and XSS test cases exist (TC19, TC20) to ensure no sensitive data leakage or execution.
State Variations & Regression: Tests cover empty DB, partially populated DB, and a regression case for deleted tag visibility (TC23, TC26, TC27).
Performance & Integration: Load/performance (normal and peak) and integration with downstream audit logging (available/unavailable) are included (TC21, TC22, TC24, TC25).
gaps: Pagination: No tests address pagination or large result sets and how pagination parameters (if any) are handled.
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching-related headers or behavior (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GETs.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although performance under load is present, there are no tests for rate-limiting, throttling, or 429 responses.
Authorization granularity: While missing/invalid token (401) is covered, there are no tests for insufficient privileges (403) or role-based access variations.
Content Negotiation / Headers: Tests do not verify response headers (Content-Type beyond JSON) or behavior for Accept headers, or handling of non-JSON requests.
Pagination-related edge cases: No tests for very large payloads in responses (stress of very many tags) or behavior when results span multiple pages.
Caching invalidation with includedDeleted/audit combinations: No tests to verify consistency between cache and different query parameter combinations that affect response content.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios with many tags to force paginated responses and verify page size, next/prev links, boundaries (first/last page) and consistent ordering.
Add caching tests: assert presence and correctness of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified), and test conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) to confirm 304 behavior.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst requests to validate throttling behavior and expected 429 responses or backoff headers.
Add authorization/permission tests: include scenarios for authenticated users without proper privileges expecting 403, and test token scopes/roles if applicable.
Add header/content-negotiation tests: verify Content-Type, Accept header handling, and robust error messaging for unsupported media types.
Add large-result stress tests: verify correctness and performance when the invoice item has a very large number of tags, including memory/latency observations.
Add cache consistency tests for query param variations: ensure cached responses do not leak deleted tags or incorrect audit info when includedDeleted or audit params change.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/search/{searchKey} - Search accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC18) exercise successful retrieval with required path param and with query parameters.
Empty Response: TC04 and TC05 cover empty-result behavior for no-matches and empty database.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for valid and invalid values: offset/limit (TC02, TC03, TC07), booleans and enums (TC02, TC08), combinations (TC03), and unexpected extras (TC14).
Pagination: Functional pagination behavior is tested (offset/limit semantics, TC02/TC03) including a large-volume scenario (TC15) that checks limit behavior and response time.
Authorization: Missing and invalid auth token scenarios are present (TC09, TC10).
Error Handling / Validation: Numerous error scenarios included for malformed searchKey, pagination, boolean/enum parsing, security (SQLi/XSS - TC12/TC13), and regression for empty searchKey (TC17).
Integration & Dependency Failures: Dependent-service failure scenario exists (TC19) to exercise 502/503 handling.
Performance / Concurrency: Load/concurrency test included (TC15 concurrent requests) and timeout/long-running operation scenario (TC16).
Security: Explicit security tests for injection/XSS (TC12, TC13).
Accessibility / Payload Structure: TC20 addresses payload clarity for assistive tech.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests verify cache-related headers or behavior (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET handling.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrency/performance is tested, there are no tests verifying rate limit enforcement, 429 responses, or behavior under throttling.

HTTP Response Codes Granularity: The spec mentions ">=400 depending on error" but few tests assert specific alternative error codes beyond 400/401/402/502/503/504; e.g., 422 for validation vs 400 is only optionally asserted in TC12. Missing explicit 422 coverage for validation vs 400 distinctions.

Boundary values for pagination limits: Tests include negative and non-integer invalids and some positive checks, but there is no explicit test for extremely large limit values, zero limit, or limit=0 behavior.
Field-level schema/contract validation: Tests assert presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit but do not validate full Account object schema (required fields, types, formats).
Caching + Authorization interaction: No tests that verify caching headers are correctly applied or omitted for authenticated responses vs unauthenticated.
Rate-limited concurrent behavior: Concurrency test checks responses under load but does not assert system behavior when limits are exceeded (backoff, retry headers).
Localization / Encoding: No tests for searchKey encoding/URL-encoding edge-cases (spaces, Unicode characters) beyond malformed chars.
HTTP headers and content-type checks: No test verifying response Content-Type or character encoding requirements.
Negative integration permutations: Dependent-service partial failures (e.g., balance service returns partial data) are not covered; only full unavailable case (TC19).
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify presence and semantics of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers and conditional GET behavior (304) for typical queries.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many requests to assert 429 responses or expected throttling behavior and appropriate Retry-After headers.
Expand pagination boundary tests: include limit=0, extremely large limit, limit at default boundary, and verify behavior and response codes.
Add strict schema/contract assertions: validate Account object field types, required fields, formats (emails, IDs), and that optional fields are omitted when not requested.
Differentiate 400 vs 422: add tests that assert the correct semantic error code for validation vs malformed input to match API contract (e.g., 422 for semantic validation if applicable).
Test URL-encoding and Unicode search keys: add tests for spaces, plus signs, percent-encoding, and non-ASCII characters to ensure correct handling.
Add header/content tests: assert Content-Type and charset, and verify that authentication and caching interact correctly (no sensitive data in caches).
Add partial dependent-service failure tests: e.g., balance service fails for some accounts to assert graceful degradation or partial error reporting.
Add rate-limited concurrency assertions: combine concurrency with rate limiting to confirm acceptable error handling and resource utilization when limits are exceeded.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC04, TC15, TC17) validate successful retrieval for latest, date-scoped, account-scoped, combined parameters, empty-catalog and large-catalog cases.
Empty Response: TC05 and TC15 cover cases where there is no catalog or an empty catalog structure.
Query Parameters: TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC16 exercise combinations of requestedDate and accountId, invalid formats, unsupported extras, and boundary lengths.
Authorization: TC10 and TC11 explicitly cover missing auth (401) and insufficient permissions (403).

Error Handling: TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC12, TC13, TC22 cover a range of error responses (404/400 for missing data, 400 for invalid params, 503 for service down, 504 for timeout, and injection handling).
Response Format & Content-Type: TC01-TC04 and others assert Content-Type text/xml and valid/well-formed XML (TC19, TC20).
Concurrency & Performance: TC17, TC18, TC21 and TC14 exercise large payload, concurrent requests, peak-load performance and transient failures/retries.
Regression & Compatibility: TC19 and TC20 provide coverage for malformed-XML regressions and backward compatibility.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios verify pagination or segmented retrieval behavior for very large catalogs (standard guideline: Pagination).
Caching Behavior: No tests assert HTTP caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrent and peak-load are addressed, there are no explicit tests for rate-limiting responses (e.g., 429) or throttling policy enforcement.

Exact Status Code Expectations for “no catalog”: The story acceptance specifies errors >=400 for missing data; tests allow 404 or 400 but do not assert which is normative — a gap in precise expected behavior/assertion.

Content negotiation/Accept header: No tests verify behavior when Accept header is missing, incorrect, or requests other formats (e.g., application/json) to ensure correct content negotiation or correct error response.

Schema validation: While tests assert "valid XML", there is no explicit test verifying adherence to a formal XML schema/DTD beyond well-formedness (TC19 hints at this but isn’t explicit about schema validation).
Authorization scope/roles: TC11 checks insufficient permission, but there is no matrix of roles/tenants to validate multi-tenant authorization boundaries in depth.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: simulate very large catalogs and verify paging parameters (if supported) or that server explicitly documents lack of pagination; include performance impact checks for paged vs. full responses.
Add caching and conditional GET tests: assert presence and correctness of ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers and verify 304 Not Modified behavior on conditional requests.
Add rate-limiting tests: generate bursts of requests to ensure rate-limiting responses (429) or throttling behavior and that proper Retry-After headers are returned.
Tighten expectations for missing-catalog errors: decide whether 400 or 404 is normative and make tests assert the single expected status and message to avoid ambiguity.
Add Accept header/content-negotiation tests: verify behavior when Accept is application/xml, text/xml, missing, or requesting unsupported types.
Add explicit XML schema validation tests: include an XSD/other schema and assert response conforms to it, not just well-formedness.
Expand authorization matrix: test tenant isolation and role-based access for multiple accountIds/tenants to ensure correct tenant-specific catalog behavior.
Add explicit tests for large-response streaming and timeout boundaries: separate performance tests from functional ones and validate acceptable SLAs and timeouts, including partial-failure handling.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/block/{blockingId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve blocking state audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01, TC19 validate successful retrieval, response code 200, content-type and schema.
Empty Response: TC02 covers the case where a valid blockingId exists but has no audit logs (empty JSON array expected).
Non-Existing Resource: TC03 and TC17 cover 404 behavior when blockingId is not found or DB is empty.
Parameter Validation: TC04 covers malformed UUID handling; TC11/TC12 cover injection/XSS payloads.
Authorization: TC05 and TC06 cover missing and invalid authentication (401 scenarios).
Service Errors / Timeouts: TC07 and TC20 cover service unavailable and gateway timeout behaviors.
Large Dataset / Performance: TC09 and TC16 cover very large histories and concurrent requests (performance/throughput concerns).
Response Structure: TC19 explicitly requires JSON schema validation for AuditLog array.
Query Parameters: TC08 verifies ignoring unexpected query parameters.
gaps: Pagination: No scenario verifies pagination behavior or that large datasets are paginated correctly (limit, offset/page, next links).
Caching Behavior: No tests check caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests exercise request throttling, rate limit headers, or behavior when limits are exceeded.

Detailed Query Parameter Validation: Only an “unexpected” query param case exists; there are no tests for valid/allowed query params, or for invalid values/formats for query parameters (if any exist).

Error Response Content: While many error codes are covered, there is limited verification of error response structure/fields (standard error schema, error codes/messages) beyond existence of a message.
HTTP Method Semantics / Idempotency: No negative tests to ensure other HTTP methods (POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE) are rejected on this endpoint, validating method safety.
Security - Authorization Scope: Tests cover auth presence/validity but do not verify authorization scope/roles (403 scenarios) if some users are forbidden to view certain audit logs.
Load/Stress: TC09/TC16 cover basic perf, but there are no sustained load or stress tests assessing system behavior under heavy sustained traffic or memory/cpu saturation.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify response contains pagination metadata (if applicable), correct page sizes, next/prev links, and behavior at boundaries (last page, empty page).
Add caching/conditional request tests: validate ETag/Last-Modified headers, If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since requests produce 304, and Cache-Control behavior.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate many requests quickly to observe 429 responses or rate-limit headers and verify graceful handling.
Add stricter error-schema assertions: validate error JSON schema for 4xx/5xx responses (fields, codes, non-sensitive messages).
Add method rejection tests: ensure non-GET methods return 405 or appropriate responses on this endpoint.
Add authorization-scope tests: include cases where authenticated user is forbidden to access specific audit logs (403) if the system supports role-based restrictions.
Expand performance tests to include sustained load and stress scenarios (long-running concurrency, memory/cpu monitoring) and validate SLAs.
Add negative query parameter tests: if the endpoint supports query params (e.g., filters, time ranges), add tests for invalid/edge values and combinations.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/priceList - Retrieve priceList for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC21, TC18) validate successful retrieval with different combinations of subscriptionId and requestedDate and edge/date-boundary behavior.
Empty Response / No Data: TC13 covers behavior when the DB has no subscriptions/price lists and expects 404 or empty/default response.
Query Parameters: Many permutations are tested — valid, omitted, malformed, oversized, extra/unexpected (TC01-TC04, TC05, TC07, TC11, TC12, TC19).
Authorization: TC08 explicitly tests missing/invalid token; background ensures auth tokens are considered for positive tests.
Error Handling for Missing/Invalid Resources: TC05 (bad format), TC06 (non-existent subscription), TC07 (bad date), TC19 (malformed/partial) cover 4xx error cases as specified in the story.
Dependency and Integration Failures: TC20 covers dependent catalog service failure (502) and TC09 covers service unavailability (503).
Security Input Validation: TC10 (injection), TC22 (XSS) cover common injection/XSS vectors and confirm no internal details are leaked.
Performance/Load: TC14 and TC15 include response-time expectations under normal and peak load, and TC17 covers retry behavior after transient failure.
Large Data Volume: TC18 addresses correctness and performance when many price list changes exist for a subscription.
Regression / Boundary Cases: TC21 checks a previously fixed date-boundary issue.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior or pagination-related query parameters for large datasets (important per GET guidelines).
Caching Behavior: There are no scenarios validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GETs, or proper cache-related response behaviors.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: While performance tests exist, there are no explicit tests for rate limiting (429 responses) or behavior when request quotas are exceeded.
Authorization Nuances: There is testing for unauthorized (401) but no explicit tests for forbidden access (403) or role-based access scenarios if applicable.

Content/Schema Validation Details: Positive scenarios assert a "valid PriceList JSON object" but there are no explicit schema/field-level tests (required fields, types, enums, boundary values) or contract tests against the PriceList definition.

Pagination-related performance: Large-data performance (TC18) is present but not tied to pagination; scenarios don’t verify page size limits, cursors, offsets, or combined performance when paginating.
Caching + Concurrency: No tests combine caching behavior with concurrent requests to ensure cache coherence and correct ETag/If-None-Match handling under concurrency.
Rate-limiting + retry semantics: TC17 covers retry after transient network failure but not retries in presence of server-side rate limiting or backoff behavior.
Response Content-headers and Content negotiation: Tests check content-type for application/json but do not validate other headers (Content-Length, charset) or accept-header negotiation.
Error body structure: Error scenarios assert message existence but do not verify standardized error schema (error codes, subcodes, correlation IDs) required for client handling.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios for endpoints returning many items and verify pagination query parameters (limit/offset or cursor), page boundaries, and combined correctness/performance when paginating.

Add caching tests: validate presence and correctness of Cache-Control and ETag headers, test conditional GETs with If-None-Match and If-Modified-Since returning 304 when appropriate, and ensure no sensitive data is leaked via caching headers.

Add rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid-fire requests to validate 429 responses, Retry-After header behavior, and client-friendly error messages; include tests for graceful degradation when limits are hit.
Cover authorization nuances: add tests for 403 Forbidden where applicable (insufficient privileges), and role-based access if the API differentiates clients.
Add schema/contract tests: assert that the PriceList JSON matches the canonical schema (required fields, types, nested objects) and include negative tests for missing/invalid fields in the response.
Test error body standardization: verify error payload structure (error code, message, details, correlation id) across 4xx/5xx to ensure clients can reliably parse errors.
Combine caching/concurrency and pagination/performance tests: validate behavior when many concurrent clients request the same resource and when cached responses are served under load.
Add content negotiation and header validation: test Accept header handling and other response headers (Content-Length, charset) to ensure robust client interoperability.
Include rate-limited retry semantics: verify client retry/backoff behavior expectations when server returns 429 and interaction with idempotency/retry logic.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

covered_items: Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC11, TC14, TC19) verify that valid requests create Tag objects and return 201.
Required/Optional Headers: Tests verify required X-Killbill-CreatedBy and optional X-Killbill-Reason/X-Killbill-Comment behavior (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC07).
Invalid Payloads/Validation: Malformed JSON, invalid tag UUID format, partial/null elements, unexpected fields are tested (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC17).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 when payment not found is covered (TC05, TC18).
Invalid Path Parameter Format: 400 for invalid paymentId format is covered (TC06).
Idempotency/Deduplication: Duplicate tag UUIDs and already-existing tags behavior is addressed (TC11, TC19).
Concurrency/Performance: Concurrency and performance under load are included (TC12, TC20).
Dependency Failure / Service Unavailability: Tag service unavailable scenario is covered (TC13).
Security: Unauthorized user and malicious payload (XSS) scenarios are present (TC15, TC16).
gaps: Pagination: No tests related to pagination/large-result paging (relevant for endpoints that could return many tags).
Caching Behavior: No checks for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) in responses.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting, burst requests, or API quota handling (guideline asks to verify multiple requests in short time).
Server Error Handling (500): No explicit test that simulates internal server/database failures returning 500 and how the client should handle them (beyond TC13 which covers a 503 dependency failure).

Tag Definition Not Found: No explicit scenario for submitting a syntactically valid tagDefinitionId that does not exist in system (should produce 4xx, e.g., 400/404), this is different from invalid format (TC09) and payment-not-found (TC05).
Content-Type / Accept Headers: No tests asserting behavior when Content-Type is missing/incorrect or Accept is not application/json.
Header Validation Beyond CreatedBy: Tests do not validate header value constraints (e.g., empty CreatedBy value, overly long strings).

Exact Response Schema/Fields Validation: While Tag objects are asserted in success cases, there is no explicit test asserting full schema conformity (field types, absence of unexpected fields) beyond basic presence checks.
recommendations: Add pagination-related tests (if endpoint can return many tags) that verify behaviour with large tag sets, proper paging parameters, and limits.
Add tests to assert caching headers on responses where applicable (ETag, Cache-Control) and behavior on conditional requests (If-None-Match) if the API supports it.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests: repeated rapid requests to verify 429 responses or expected throttling behavior and recovery.
Add server-failure tests to simulate DB or internal errors and verify 500 responses and safe failure modes; expand TC13 to cover 500 as well as 503.
Add tests for non-existent tag definition IDs (valid UUID format but non-existing resource) and assert proper 4xx response and error message.
Add Content-Type/Accept header validation tests: missing/incorrect Content-Type should return 400/415 as appropriate; responses should respect Accept header.
Add header validation tests for X-Killbill-CreatedBy (empty, extremely long, invalid characters) to ensure server-side validation and clear error messages.
Add strict schema validation tests for returned Tag objects verifying required fields, types, and no unexpected fields (to satisfy the "Produces: application/json" and schema requirements).
If strong idempotency guarantees are claimed, add more rigorous concurrent tests with assertions on final DB state and deduplication under race conditions (extend TC20).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC05) validate successful retrieval with default and explicit audit parameter values.
Empty Response: TC04 covers the case where an invoice item has no custom fields (empty JSON array expected).
Query Parameters: Good coverage for audit parameter permutations including valid values (FULL, MINIMAL, NONE) and invalid value (TC19). TC11 covers extra/unsupported query parameters being ignored.
Authorization: TC08 tests unauthorized access (401).
Input Validation: TC06 (invalid UUID format), TC10 (injection characters), TC21 (XSS payload) cover malformed/malicious invoiceItemId inputs.
Not Found Handling: TC07 and TC17 cover non-existent invoice item and empty DB cases returning 404.
Service/Dependency Failures: TC09 (service/db unavailable), TC20 (external audit dependency unavailable) cover 503 and dependency failure scenarios; TC16 covers gateway timeout (504).
Performance/Scale: TC12 (large volume) and TC15 (concurrent requests) address scale and concurrency concerns.
Response Format & Accessibility: TC22 verifies valid JSON and descriptive field names; success scenarios assert JSON array of CustomField objects and audit presence/absence (TC01, TC13).
Partial Path Input: TC18 checks missing invoiceItemId in path and expected error handling.
gaps: Pagination: There are no tests for pagination (page/limit/offset) or behavior when results exceed page sizes; TC12 tests large dataset content but not paginated responses or pagination headers.
Caching / Conditional GET: No tests check caching headers or conditional requests (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control) or 304 Not Modified behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrency is tested (TC15), there are no tests asserting rate limit responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under throttling.
Authorization nuances: 403 Forbidden is not covered (authorized but lacking permissions), nor are token expiry/invalid scopes tested.

Schema validation / Content-Type headers: Tests assert JSON body but do not validate full JSON schema for CustomField object, content-type header, or strict field-level validation (types, required fields).
Pagination performance / limits: No tests for server behavior when extremely large responses cause memory/time issues other than general timeout (TC16).
Caching interaction with audit parameter: No tests that verify how audit levels affect caching or cacheability of responses.
Header-level checks: No tests for standard headers (Content-Type, Cache-Control, ETag, Retry-After on 503/429) or for consistent use of API versioning via headers.
Error payload consistency: Tests expect error messages but do not validate standardized error schema (fields, codes) across error responses.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include scenarios that request page/limit parameters, verify pagination headers/body (next/prev links, total count), and behavior when requesting past-last page.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: test ETag and If-None-Match to validate 304 responses, verify Cache-Control and other cache headers for different audit levels.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many requests in short time to assert 429 responses and Retry-After header behavior.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 cases (valid token but insufficient permissions), expired token, and token with wrong scopes.
Add JSON schema validation tests: assert full CustomField object schema (field presence, types, allowed values) and Content-Type header (application/json).
Harden error response tests: verify error response schema consistently for 400/404/401/403/429/503/504 cases, including machine-readable error codes.
Clarify and measure performance thresholds: for TC12 and TC15, define explicit acceptable response time SLAs and assert them; add stress tests for very large payloads impacting memory/latency.
Test caching interplay with audit parameter and dependencies: ensure responses with audit=FULL are not incorrectly cached or that caching headers reflect audit sensitivity.
Add tests for header consistency and API version compatibility beyond Accept header (e.g., Accept-Version or custom headers) and verify backward compatibility artifacts explicitly.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Retrieve account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (no params, withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit values, combined params) validate correct 200 responses and response body content.
Empty Response: TC08 covers account with no payment methods returning an empty JSON array.
Query Parameters: Positive and negative tests for query params are present (withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, invalid audit, extra/unexpected params).
Request Validation: Invalid accountId format and SQL-injection style accountId tests are present and mapped to 400 responses.
Error Scenarios: Account not found (404), service unavailable (503), network timeout, dependent plugin unavailable (502/503) and recovery on retry are included.
Security: Tests for SQL injection and XSS on pluginProperty are present.
Scale/Performance: Large dataset scenario (more than 100 payment methods) exists and includes a response-time expectation.
Regression/Compatibility: Regression and backward-compatibility scenarios ensure behavior consistency with prior contract.
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination behavior, page size limits, offsets or continuation tokens for large result sets.
Authorization specifics: There is one negative auth test for missing token (401) but no tests for insufficient privileges (403) or role-based access differences.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for how the API behaves under rapid repeated requests or when rate limits are exceeded.
Caching Behavior / Headers: No checks for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GETs (If-None-Match / 304), or Last-Modified behavior.
Response Headers and Content-Type: No explicit tests verifying Content-Type application/json, charset, or other relevant headers (e.g., Content-Length, Retry-After).

Schema / Contract Validation: While body expectations exist, there are no explicit schema/field-level assertions (required fields, data types, nullability) or negative tests for malformed PaymentMethod objects.

Pagination performance + large dataset correctness: The large dataset test expects all payment methods in a single response; without pagination checks this could be unrealistic for production-scale data.
Rate-limiting recovery/backoff: No tests covering retry/backoff strategies aside from one transient dependency recovery scenario.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include scenarios for large result sets with page size, page number, offsets, and verify behavior when requesting beyond available pages. Test both presence and absence of pagination headers or mechanisms used by the API.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 tests for authenticated but unauthorized users, role-based access tests, and token-expiry handling.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid repeated requests to verify 429 or other rate-limit behavior and ensure Retry-After is present/useful.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match to get 304 responses, and ensure responses include appropriate caching headers.
Assert response headers and content-type explicitly: add checks for Content-Type: application/json and other relevant headers (Content-Length, Retry-After when applicable).
Add explicit schema/field-level validations: assert required PaymentMethod properties, types (e.g., UUIDs, timestamps), and behavior when fields are missing or malformed.

Refine large-dataset handling: decide whether the API should paginate. If so, update tests to assert partial results per page and that aggregation across pages returns the full set; if not, document and test memory/timeout consequences.
Add rate-limiting recovery/backoff tests and tests for idempotency of repeated safe GETs when transient errors occur.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered_items: Valid Deletion: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC11, TC12, TC16) exercise successful deletion of all or specific tags and response 204.
Non-Existent Resource: TC06 checks behavior when bundleId does not exist (404).
Invalid Input Validation: TC05, TC07, TC13 cover invalid bundleId format and invalid/partial invalid tagDef values returning 400.
Headers Validation: TC03 validates behavior when optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are present; TC08 checks missing required X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Authorization / Authentication: TC09 covers unauthorized access returning 401.
Service Availability / Error Handling: TC10 (503) and TC18 (timeout/504 or 204) cover service unavailability and timeouts.
Concurrency: TC15 tests concurrent DELETE requests and checks for race conditions/data corruption.
Edge Cases & Scale: TC12 (large number of tagDefs) and TC18 (extremely large number leading to timeout) test scale and performance boundaries.
Regression & Integration: TC16 validates a previously-fixed bug (empty tagDef array), and TC17 verifies data consistency via a GET after deletion.
Security Input Sanitization: TC14 covers XSS / injection content in headers.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior for endpoints that might return paged tag lists (relevant for GET list endpoints) or interactions when large datasets are involved beyond mass-delete stress.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache coherence after deletion.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrency is tested, there are no explicit tests for rate limiting (429) or throttling policies.
Soft Delete vs Hard Delete Semantics: No tests validate whether tags are soft-deleted (marked) vs permanently removed or whether deleted tags can be recovered/audited.
Idempotency and Repeatability: No explicit tests ensure repeated identical DELETE requests are idempotent (e.g., deleting already-removed tags consistently returns 204).
Authorization Granularity: TC09 covers unauthorized user generally, but there is no distinction between 401 vs 403 or role-based permission matrix tests.
Response Headers and Content-Type: Tests do not assert response headers (e.g., Content-Type application/json when errors produced) or presence/format of error payloads beyond existence of message.
Database/Storage Error Handling (500): Tests do not simulate internal server/database failures resulting in 500 responses.

Boundary validations for query parameter length and number: While TC12/TC18 test large volumes, there are no tests for server limits (e.g., maximum allowed number of tagDef params) and behavior when exceeded.
recommendations: Add idempotency tests: repeated DELETE of same tag(s) should be tested to confirm consistent 204 responses (or documented alternate behavior).
Add soft-delete semantics tests: verify whether tags are permanently removed or soft-deleted; include tests for audit logs and recovery if applicable.
Add caching tests: verify presence/absence and correctness of caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and that GET after DELETE returns fresh data (no stale cache).
Add explicit rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid request bursts to verify 429 responses or throttling behavior and graceful handling.
Add tests for server error conditions (500) by simulating DB or storage failures to ensure errors are surfaced properly.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 scenarios for forbidden operations, role-based access matrix, and token expiry/invalid token cases.
Add response schema assertions: verify Content-Type and structured error payloads (fields, codes) for 4xx/5xx responses.
Add boundary tests for query parameter limits: test when the number of tagDef params exceeds configured limits and validate error handling/response codes.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Retrieve account invoice payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC06, TC16, TC20) validate successful retrieval for valid accountId and combinations of query parameters.
Empty Response: TC07 and TC17 cover accounts with no invoice payments and partially populated DB states.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for withPluginInfo, withAttempts, pluginProperty, audit values (TC02-TC06, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC19).
Authorization: TC10 verifies missing/invalid authentication leads to 401 unauthorized.
Input Validation / Error Handling: TC08 (malformed UUID -> 400) and TC09 (not found -> 404) cover path parameter validation and not-found behavior; TC12 covers invalid enum for audit.
Security: TC23 and TC24 include SQL injection and XSS attempts on accountId and pluginProperty respectively.
Integration & Resilience: TC18 addresses downstream service unavailability (plugin/attempt service) and expected partial/failure behavior.
Performance & Load: TC15, TC21, TC22 check large dataset behavior and response-time expectations.
Regression & Backwards Compatibility: TC19 and TC20 cover regression and legacy-client behavior.
gaps: Pagination details: Although TC15 mentions “paginated as per API limits”, there are no explicit tests that verify pagination semantics (page size, page tokens/offsets, links, next/prev behavior) or assertions about consistency of paginated results.
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GET handling (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified) or cacheability of responses.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No scenarios exercise rate-limiting (429) or how repeated rapid requests are handled.
Authorization scope/permissions: There is a test for missing/invalid token (401) but no tests for forbidden access (403) or role-based access restrictions if applicable.
Header / Content-Type / Schema validation: Tests don’t assert response headers (Content-Type) or strict schema/field-level validation for InvoicePayment objects beyond "required payment fields".
Query param type errors and parsing: Missing tests for malformed boolean/query param types (e.g., withPluginInfo=notABool) and percent-encoding edge cases beyond pluginProperty examples.
Pagination performance and consistency: No tests validating ordering, stable sorting across pages, or consistent snapshot behavior when data changes during pagination.
Caching + Authorization interactions: No coverage for interactions like private vs public cache headers or auth-sensitive caching.
Rate limiting under concurrent load combined with peak-performance tests: Performance tests exist but not combined with rate-limiting/throttling scenarios.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: create data that requires multiple pages and assert page size, total counts (if provided), next/prev links or offset/token semantics, and that combined query params work across pages.
Add caching tests: assert presence/absence of Cache-Control and ETag headers, test conditional GET using If-None-Match expecting 304, and validate cache behavior with and without auth.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst traffic to validate 429 responses and Retry-After behavior and ensure graceful degradation.
Add authorization scope tests: include scenarios for authenticated-but-forbidden (403) such as users without permission to view account payments, and tests for token expiry handling.
Tighten schema assertions: add tests that validate the full InvoicePayment JSON schema (field types, formats, required fields) and Content-Type header.
Add malformed query param tests: pass invalid boolean/enum formats (e.g., withPluginInfo=abc, withAttempts=2) and assert 400 responses with clear error messages.
Add pagination consistency tests: while paginating, mutate dataset (create/delete payments) and assert documented snapshot/consistency behavior or document expected behavior.
Combine load + rate-limit tests: run peak load tests that also verify rate-limiting and graceful failure modes under sustained high concurrency.
Add caching + auth interaction tests: ensure auth-protected responses are not cached publicly and that appropriate cache headers are set.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/pagination - List accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Many scenarios validate successful responses for default and custom parameters (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC25, TC28, TC30, TC43, TC50).
Empty Response: Scenarios for no accounts and offset beyond data are present (TC08, TC09).
Pagination: Numerous tests cover offset/limit behavior, boundary conditions and large-volume retrieval (TC02, TC19, TC21, TC27, TC46, TC48, TC49).
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid, invalid, malformed, combined, omitted and extra parameters (TC03, TC04, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC23, TC24, TC38, TC39, TC42, TC44, TC45, TC29).
Authorization: Auth success and failure cases are included (Background auth, TC15, TC16).

Error Handling: Various error scenarios covered including invalid params, method not allowed, service unavailable, dependency failures and timeouts (TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC17, TC18, TC32, TC40, TC41).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts are explicitly tested (TC23, TC24).
Concurrency & Recovery: Concurrency, retry and recovery from transient/dependency errors covered (TC20, TC36, TC37).
Integration & Data Consistency: Integration with balance and audit services and audit consistency checks are present (TC32, TC33).
Accessibility & Usability: Response structure and descriptive error messages covered (TC34, TC35).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios verify behavior under aggressive request rates or throttling responses (e.g., 429).
Caching Behavior: No tests inspect HTTP caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or behavior across conditional requests.
Content-Type / Headers Validation: No explicit checks for Content-Type, charset, or other relevant response headers.

Response Schema Validation: While Account fields are mentioned, there are no explicit schema validation tests for required/optional fields, types, or example values (beyond presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit).
403 Authorization vs 401: Tests cover 401 but do not explicitly verify 403 / role-based access control scenarios (if applicable).
Rate-limit + Pagination interaction: No tests combine high request rates with pagination to observe stability under load and consistent paging.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst traffic and assert correct throttling behavior (429 responses) and retry-after headers.
Add caching tests: verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified; include conditional GET (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) to assert 304 responses where appropriate.
Add header and content-type checks: assert Content-Type is application/json and validate common headers (Date, Server, etc.).
Add strict JSON schema validation tests: validate each Account object against the API contract (required fields, types, nested structures) not just presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit.
Add authorization/ACL tests for 403 scenarios if role-based restrictions exist (ensure least-privilege behavior).
Add stress tests combining high concurrency and pagination to detect inconsistent slices, race conditions and performance degradation (rate-limit + pagination interaction).
Add negative/edge tests for very large header/query sizes and ensure no header-based exploits are possible beyond 414/400 already listed.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request (PUT): Multiple success scenarios (TC01-TC07, TC21, TC22, TC28) validate successful refresh and optional query parameters (pluginName, pluginProperty).
Required headers: Presence/absence of X-Killbill-CreatedBy is tested (TC05, TC10).
Query parameters: pluginName and pluginProperty single/multiple/large/encoding cases are exercised (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC07, TC21).
Non-existent / invalid account handling: Invalid UUID format and non-existent account are covered (TC08, TC09, TC27, TC19).
Error handling for external dependencies: External gateway/plugin service unavailable and slow gateway/timeouts are covered (TC13, TC20, TC25).
Authorization: Unauthorized access via invalid/missing auth token is covered (TC15).
Concurrency / performance: Concurrent requests and performance under load are addressed (TC14, TC23, TC24, TC29).
Security: Injection/XSS attempts for pluginName and pluginProperty are included (TC16, TC17).
Edge cases and unexpected inputs: Extra query params, very large pluginProperty payloads, malformed pluginProperty, and other edge cases are included (TC12, TC18, TC24).
Integration / data consistency: Post-refresh consistency and regression conditions are included (TC26, TC21).
